ascc 0.0.0.9000

    ascc

    Magnus Kinder

    ascc.Rmd

    Goal

    This is a guide for adaptive single-cell classification of mass cytometry data. The guide implements the R package at https://github.com/magnuskinder/ascc.

    Import packages

    library(ascc)

    Data preprocessing

    We use mouse bone marrow data from http://web.stanford.edu/~samusik/vortex/ to illustrate the method.

    url="http://web.stanford.edu/~samusik/Panorama%20BM%201-10.zip"
download.file(url,"data.zip")
unzip("data.zip")
fileList = list.files(path=getwd(), pattern="*.fcs", full.names = TRUE)
path = paste(getwd(),"/population_assignments.txt",sep="")
fcs_labels = read.delim(path, header=FALSE)
fcs_labels = fcs_labels %>% separate(c("V1"), into=c("File", "Event", "Cell"), sep=" ")
#> Warning: Expected 3 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 1 rows [164401].
fcs_labels = fcs_labels[complete.cases(fcs_labels),]
names(fcs_labels) = c("File", "Event", "Cell", "CellType")
    #fileList = list.files(path = "E:/Paper/Panorama BM 1-10", pattern = "*.fcs", full.names = TRUE)
url="http://web.stanford.edu/~samusik/Panorama%20BM%201-10.zip"
download.file(url,"data.zip")
unzip("data.zip")
fileList = list.files(path=getwd(), pattern="*.fcs", full.names = TRUE)
readFiles = lapply(fileList, read.FCS)
dataTransform = list()

for (i in seq(1, length(readFiles), by=1)){
  asinhTrans = arcsinhTransform(transformationId="ln-transformation", a=0, b=0.2, c=0)
  translist = transformList(colnames(readFiles[[i]])[3:50], asinhTrans)
  dataTransform[[i]] = transform(readFiles[[i]], translist)
}
dfFiles = lapply(dataTransform, exprs)

map_mouse = function(x) {
  if (str_detect(x, "_01_")) "1"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_02_")) "2"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_03_")) "3"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_04_")) "4"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_05_")) "5"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_06_")) "6"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_07_")) "7"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_08_")) "8"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_09")) "9"
  else if (str_detect(x, "_10_")) "10"
  else NA
}

subFile = sub("\\.fcs.*", "", fileList)

fileTable = tibble(
  mouse = sapply(fileList, map_mouse) %>% as.factor,
  path_name = paste0("", fileList),
  file_name = substring(subFile,regexpr("BM2.*", subFile)),
)

dataList = list()
for (i in seq(1,length(dfFiles), by=1)){
  data = data.frame(dfFiles[[i]])
  data$File = fileTable$file_name[i]
  data$mouse = fileTable$mouse[i]
  data$Cell = seq(1,nrow(dfFiles[[i]]),by=1)
  dataList[[i]] = data
}
df = do.call(rbind, dataList)

new_names = readFiles[[1]]@parameters$desc
lst_names = c()
for (i in seq(1,length(new_names),by=1)) {
  lst_names[i] = new_names[[i]]
}
setnames(df, old = c(head(colnames(df), 51)), new = c(lst_names))

#fcs_labels = read.csv("E:/Paper/Panorama BM 1-10/population_assignments.csv")
path = paste(getwd(),"/population_assignments.txt",sep="")
fcs_labels = read.delim(path, header=FALSE)
fcs_labels = fcs_labels %>% separate(c("V1"), into=c("File", "Event", "Cell"), sep=" ")
#> Warning: Expected 3 pieces. Missing pieces filled with `NA` in 1 rows [164401].
fcs_labels = fcs_labels[complete.cases(fcs_labels),]
names(fcs_labels) = c("File", "Event", "Cell", "CellType")

fcs_labels$Cell = as.numeric(fcs_labels$Cell)
fcs_labels$Cell = fcs_labels$Cell + 1
df1 = merge(df, fcs_labels, by = c('Cell','File'))


df_full = df1[with(df1, order(mouse, Cell)),]

    Data setup

    • Split data into two disjoint sets: train and test set.
    • Split the train set into an actual train set and a calibration set.
    set.seed(1)

df_subset = df_full %>% group_by(mouse,CellType) %>% sample_n(20, replace=TRUE)
df_subset$CellType = factor(df_subset$CellType)
random_rows = sample(nrow(df_subset))
df_subset = df_subset[random_rows,]


basic_removal = c('File', 'Event', 'Time', 'Cell_length', 'CellType', 'mouse', 'Cell', 'beadDist')
mice = sort(c(unique(df_subset$mouse)))
select_mice = sample(mice, 1)
df_test = df_subset %>% dplyr::filter(mouse == select_mice)
df_train_cal = df_subset %>% dplyr::filter(mouse != select_mice)

other_mice = setdiff(c(unique(df_subset$mouse)), select_mice)
calibration_mice = c(sample(other_mice, 1))
df_calibration = df_train_cal %>% dplyr::filter(mouse %in% calibration_mice)
df_actual_train = df_train_cal %>% dplyr::filter(!mouse %in% calibration_mice)
df_actual_train$CellType = as.factor(df_actual_train$CellType)

x_train = df_actual_train[, !colnames(df_actual_train) %in% basic_removal]
y_train = df_actual_train$CellType

x_cal = df_calibration[, !colnames(df_calibration) %in% basic_removal]
y_cal = df_calibration$CellType

x_test = df_test[, !colnames(df_test) %in% basic_removal]
y_test = df_test$CellType

    Adaptive single-cell predictions

    Example with no feature selection

    • The parameter â€˜methodâ€™ can be set to either â€˜svmâ€™ : support vector classifier, or â€˜rfâ€™ : random forest classifier.
    • The parameter â€˜epsilonâ€™ is set such that we achieve 1-epsilon coverage.
    • â€˜feature_selectionâ€™ is a boolean data type; it can be set to TRUE or FALSE. If set to TRUE, one can indicate the number of feature to select with the parameter â€˜num_featuresâ€™.
    result = ascc::adaptive_conformal(x_train, y_train, x_cal, y_cal, x_test, y_test, method='rf', epsilon=0.1, feature_selection = FALSE)
marg_cov = ascc::marginal_coverage(y_test, result)
card_set = ascc::cardinality_set(result)
cat("Marginal coverage: ", marg_cov)
#> Marginal coverage:  0.9041667
    cat("Average set size: ", card_set)
#> Average set size:  1.264583

    Example with feature selection

    result_foci = ascc::adaptive_conformal(x_train, y_train, x_cal, y_cal, x_test, y_test, method='rf', epsilon=0.1, feature_selection = TRUE)
marg_cov_foci = ascc::marginal_coverage(y_test, result_foci)
card_set_foci = ascc::cardinality_set(result_foci)
cat("Marginal coverage: ", marg_cov_foci)
#> Marginal coverage:  0.93125
    cat("Average set size: ", card_set_foci)
#> Average set size:  1.160417
